array.string: Confucius, founder of Confucianism, is born.
The Fall of the Babylonian Empire and liberation of the Jews by Cyrus the Great.
Greek democracy created at Athens was direct, rather than representative: any adult male citizen over the age of 20 could take part, and it was a duty to do so
Greek city-states defeat Persian invasion at Battle of Marathon
Socrates was a classical Greek Athenian philosopher. Credited as one of the founders of Western philosophy.
The end of the Persian Wars led to the rise of Athens as the leader of the Delian League.
Beginning of the Peloponnesian war between the Greek city-states
Alexander the Great defeats Darius III of Persia completing his conquest of Persia.
Qin Shi Huang unifies China beginning of Imperial rule in China which lasts until 1912.
The Roman era of Greek history began with the Corinthian defeat in the Battle of Corinth.
